result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court deems def eligible for any and all treatment programs that are now available or that become available in the future.

Defendant shall have an IID installed on any vehicle titled in his/her name.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle that is not equipped with an IID.  Defendant is entitled to a 50% reduction in installing the IID.
No DNA sample or surcharge required.  Confirmed sample on file.

judgments.dispoDesc: Defendant was originally found guilty on 12/12/2017 at jury trial.  On 12/27/17, the Court dismissed Count #2 and sentenced defendant on Count #1 only.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Virgil L Jacobs in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 2:14 p.m.  Makes motion to dismiss 16CF37.  Court grants dismissal.  States agreement in other cases.   16CF16, Def will plead NC.  15CF48, stipulated sentencing.  Court addresses parties.  In 15CF48, Court dismisses Count #2 and def will be sentenced on Count #1.  Court sentences as follows:  3 years prison followed by 2 years of ES.  Def is eligible for Substance Abuse Program but not eligible for CIP due to age.  Eligible for all treatment programs available.  Def shall recieve credit for 22 days.  2 year revocation lf DL, 2 year IID requirement, Costs, DNA sample and surcharge if not one on file.  Court also grants half priced IID and any bond posted is forfeited towards financial obligations.  As to case #16CF16, def pleads NC.  No coercion, PLQ filed.  Admits signing, no coercion.  Freely and knowingly pleads per Atty Hoffmann.  Court Witholds sentencing and places def on probation for a period of one year, consecutive to prison sentence.  Costs also ordered.    16CF37 is dismissed as is 15TR876 and 875.  Adj.  2:25 p.m.  klr
List of jurors
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 27, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
from Jury Trial
State's Request for Jury Instructions with full text instructions

Matthew J. Tingstad appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph S. Hoffmann appeared on behalf of def who is not present.  Attorney Hoffman states motions.  Motion to Reconsider Adj. Attorney Hoffmann states motion.  DA objects.  Court denies motion.  Motion re Hearsay Evidence- Atty Hoffmann states motion.  DA responds.  Motion granted.  Motion re Prior Criminal Convictions-Atty Hoffmann states motion.  Court will allow limited questioning.  Discussion re JI 140.  Court will not modify instructions.  Attorney Hoffmann offers further argument re JI 140.  Court restates is not changing.  Attorney Hoffmann references that only one case today.  Per Court, Only 15CF48 to be heard today.  Atty Hoffmann requests that if witness appears, he have permission to treat as hostile.  Per Court, if witness presents to Court as one, will allow atty Hoffmann to treat as such.  Atty Hoffmann requests sequestration of witnesses-Court grants.  Atty Hoffmann makes reference to Motion to Exclude Testimony re Prior OWIs.  Per Court, can inquire of history.  Parties stipulate to fact of .02 BAC.  Off record at 9:03 a.m.  Back on record at 10:17 a.m. Defendant and Officer Kyle Mabie now also present.  Jury panel sworn in.  Court questions panel.  Counsel state witnesses.  Court questions panel.  Counsel voir dire panel.  10:38, Counsel make strikes.  Juror #32 has question.  Counsel do not change strikes.  Jury panel sworn in at 10:45 a.m.  Other jurors released.  Recess at 10:50 a.m.  DA recalls case at 10:58 a.m.  Opening statement by DA Tingstad  11:04 a.m. Opening Statement of Atty Hoffmann.  11:09 a.m.  Kyle Mabie sworin in.  Direct by DA.  Officer identifies def.  Exh. #1, marked/offerred/received.  Exhibit #2, marked, offerred received.  No objections from Atty Hoffmann.  11:28 a.m.  Cross by Atty Hoffmann.  Exhibit #3 and Exh. #4 marked/offerred/received.  No objection from DA.  Atty asks that officer stay under subpoena.  11:37 a.m.  Redirect by DA.  11:42 p.m.  Officer Scott Kuklinski sworn in.  Direct by DA.  Officer identifies def.  Exhibit #5 marked/offerred/received.  No objections.  No cross.  Witness released at 11:46 a.m.  11:48 a.m.  Amy H. sworn in-direct by DA.  Exhibit #6 marked/offerred/received.  No objection.  Exhibit #7 marked/offerred/recieved  witout objection.  No cross by Atty Hoffmann.  11:55 a.m.  Recess for lunch.  Jurors released.  11:56 a.m.  Judge questions parties re witnesses.  12:52 p.m.  Beth H. sworn in, direct by DA.  1:00 Cross by Atty Hoffmann.  1:05 p.m. No redirect, witness released.  State rests.  1:06 p.m.  Discussion held re prior convictions.  Per Court, limited questioning re convictions.  1:15 p.m.  Craig R. sworn in.  Investigator for pu blic def.  Direct by Atty Hoffmann.  Exhibit #8 and #9 marked/offerred/recieved without o bjection.  1:22 p.m.  Cross by DA.  1:24 p.m.  Redirect by Atty Hoffmann.  1:25 p.m.  Witness released.  1:26 p.m.  Def sworn in, direct by Atty Hoffmann.  1:31 p.m.  Cross by DA.  1:36 p.m.  Redirect by Atty Hoffmann.  1:38 p.m.  Witness released.  1:38 p.m. Officer Mabie called by DA as rebuttal witness.  Direct by DA.  1:41 p.m.  Cross by Atty Hoffmann.  1:43 p.m.  Redirect by DA.  Witness released.  1:44 p.m.  Defendant called for rebuttal by Atty Hoffmann.  1:47 p.m.  DA cross.  Witness released.  Defense rests.  Off record.  Back on record at 1:56 p.m.  Atty Hoffmann requests judicial notice be taken that 11/11/15 was a Wednesday.  Request is granted.  1:57 p.m.  Off record.  Back on record at 2:08 p.m.  Attorney Hoffmann failed to as a question of Craig R.  Court allows defense to recall witness.  Instructions conf held.  59, 103, 115, 140, 145, 147, 148, 155, 157, 1160, 170, 190, 195, 200, 201, 300, 327, 460, 484, 515, 525-agreed upon instructions.  Verdict form also acceptible.  2:12 p.m.  Back on record.  Craig R. still under oath, direct by Atty Hoffmann.  2:13 p.m.  Closing by DA.  2:19 p.m.  Closing by Atty Hoffmann.  2:25 p.m.  Rebuttal by DA.  2:26 Jury instructions given to jury.  2:41 Bailiff sworn in.  2:42 p.m.  Case with jury.  3:05 p.m.  Jury verdict in.  Jury brought back into court.  3:06 p.m.  Court reads verdict.  Jury finds def guilty on both Counts.  Natalie P. is foreperson.  3:06 p.m.  Court reads final instruction.  3:06 p.m.  DA requests defendant be remanded to jail.  Court remands def to jail.  Def taken into custody.  Per atty Hoffmann, other counts to be taken up at sentencing.  No PSI requested.  Adj. at 3:09 p.m.  klr

Defendant Virgil L Jacobs in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 11:10 a.m.  Cites appearances.  16CF37 set for initial appearance, other cases set for STC.  Attorney gives background on 16CF37.  Bail was modified.  DA agrees to modify bond to $5,000 signature bond with conditions.  Defendant agrees.  Court amends to $5,000 signature bond with conditions of no alcohol, no taverns, no liquor stores, no controlled substances.  Def waives right to prelim per atty Hoffmann.  Court grants waiver.  Case proceeds to arraignment.  Information filed.  Def waives reading and stands mute.  Clerk to enter NG.  Bond set is omnibus for all cases.  All cases to be set for jury trial.  Adjourned at 11:15 a.m.  klr
This bond covers 15CF48, 16CF16 and 16CF37.  No alcohol, no taverns, no liquor stores, no controlled substances.
